SEARCH
Package it.polimi.GC13.model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.GC13.model.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Board extends Object implements Serializable
Board class represents the game board. Each player has a board, in which players can place their cards during the game and all the collected resources are stored.
The class implements Serializable to support object serialization.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(Player owner)
      Constructs a new Board for the specified owner player.
      Parameters:
      owner - player that will place his cards on this board

  • Method Details

    • getBoardMap

      public Map<Coordinates,Cell> getBoardMap()
      Retrieves the map representing the board layout.
      Returns:
      The map of coordinates to cells on the board.

    • getCollectedResources

      public EnumMap<Resource,Integer> getCollectedResources()
      Retrieves the collected resources on the board.
      Returns:
      The EnumMap containing counts of each resource type collected on the board.

    • resourceVerifier

      public void resourceVerifier(PlayableCard cardToPlace) throws GenericException
      Verifies if the resources required by the given card can be placed on the board.
      Parameters:
      cardToPlace - The card to be placed on the board.
      Throws:
      GenericException - If there are not enough resources on the board to place the card.

    • isPossibleToPlace

      public Coordinates isPossibleToPlace(int X, int Y) throws GenericException
      Checks if it's possible to place a card at the specified coordinates on the board.
      Parameters:
      X - coordinate x
      Y - coordinate y
      Returns:
      returns the coordinate from the board if it is possible to place or throw a GenericException
      Throws:
      GenericException - if the cell is not available and notifying the client as well

    • placeCardToTheBoard

      public void placeCardToTheBoard(Coordinates xy, PlayableCard cardToPlace, boolean isFlipped) throws GenericException
      Places the specified card on the board at the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      xy - coordinate to place card
      cardToPlace - card to place on the board
      isFlipped - side to place the card
      Throws:
      GenericException - exception thrown in case the card isn't placed on the board for any reason

    • surroundingCardsNumber

      public int surroundingCardsNumber(int x, int y)
      Counts the number of surrounding cards at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate to check.
      y - The y-coordinate to check.
      Returns:
      The number of surrounding cards.

    • removeResources

      public void removeResources(int x, int y)
      Removes resources from the board when a card covers them.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate to remove resources.
      y - The y-coordinate to remove resources.

    • addResource

      public void addResource(PlayableCard cardToPlace, boolean isFlipped)
      Adds resources to the board based on the card placed and its orientation.
      Parameters:
      cardToPlace - The card that is being placed on the board.
      isFlipped - Indicates whether the card is flipped (back side) or not.

    • checkListContainsCoordinates

      public boolean checkListContainsCoordinates(Set<Coordinates> coordinatesList, Coordinates coordinatesToCheck)
      Checks if a given set of coordinates exists within a list of coordinates.
      Parameters:
      coordinatesList - The list of coordinates to check.
      coordinatesToCheck - The coordinates to search for in the list.
      Returns:
      True if the coordinates list contains the coordinates to check, false otherwise.

    • getCoordinateFromList

      public Coordinates getCoordinateFromList(Set<Coordinates> coordinatesList, Coordinates coordinatesToCheck)
      Retrieves a specific coordinate from a list of coordinates, if it exists.
      Parameters:
      coordinatesList - The list of coordinates to search within.
      coordinatesToCheck - The coordinates to retrieve from the list.
      Returns:
      The found coordinates if present in the list, otherwise null.
